channel.title: CVE Feed for CyberPower -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for CyberPower -- all

item.title: CVE-2024-32736|2024-05-09T14:57:38.850Z -- CyberPower -- CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise
item.description: A sql injection vulnerability exists in CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise prior to v2.8.3. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leak sensitive information via the "query_utask_verbose" function within MCUDBHelper.

item.title: CVE-2024-32042|2024-05-15T19:39:08.086Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description:
The key used to encrypt passwords stored in the database can be found in the CyberPower PowerPanel
application code, allowing the passwords to be recovered.

item.title: CVE-2024-32737|2024-05-09T14:57:57.579Z -- CyberPower -- CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise
item.description: A sql injection vulnerability exists in CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise prior to v2.8.3. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leak sensitive information via the "query_contract_result" function within MCUDBHelper.

item.title: CVE-2024-32053|2024-05-15T19:34:30.153Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description:
Hard-coded credentials are used by the CyberPower PowerPanel
platform to authenticate to the database, other services, and the cloud. This could result in an attacker gaining access to services with the privileges of a Powerpanel business application.

item.title: CVE-2024-32047|2024-05-15T19:36:41.936Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description: Hard-coded credentials for the CyberPower PowerPanel test server can be found in the production code. This might result in an attacker gaining access to the testing or production server.

item.title: CVE-2024-32738|2024-05-09T14:58:13.209Z -- CyberPower -- CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise
item.description: A sql injection vulnerability exists in CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise prior to v2.8.3. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leak sensitive information via the "query_ptask_lean" function within MCUDBHelper.

item.title: CVE-2024-32739|2024-05-09T14:58:30.263Z -- CyberPower -- CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise
item.description: A sql injection vulnerability exists in CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise prior to v2.8.3. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leak sensitive information via the "query_ptask_verbose" function within MCUDBHelper.

item.title: CVE-2024-32735|2024-05-09T14:54:45.407Z -- CyberPower -- CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise
item.description: An issue regarding missing authentication for certain utilities exists in CyberPower PowerPanel Enterprise prior to v2.8.3. An unauthenticated remote attacker can access the PDNU REST APIs, which may result in compromise of the application.

item.title: CVE-2024-33625|2024-05-15T19:19:53.960Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description: CyberPower PowerPanel business application code contains a hard-coded JWT signing key. This could result in an attacker forging JWT tokens to bypass authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-33615|2024-05-15T19:23:24.378Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description:
A specially crafted Zip file containing path traversal characters can be imported to the CyberPower PowerPanel
server, which allows file writing to the server outside the intended scope, and could allow an attacker to achieve remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-34025|2024-05-15T19:17:37.188Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description: CyberPower PowerPanel business application code contains a hard-coded set of authentication credentials. This could result in an attacker bypassing authentication and gaining administrator privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-31409|2024-05-15T20:00:22.532Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description:
Certain MQTT wildcards are not blocked on the CyberPower PowerPanel
system, which might result in an attacker obtaining data from throughout the system after gaining access to any device.

item.title: CVE-2024-31410|2024-05-15T19:56:00.616Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description: The devices which CyberPower PowerPanel manages use identical certificates based on a hard-coded cryptographic key. This can allow an attacker to impersonate any client in the system and send malicious data.

item.title: CVE-2024-31856|2024-05-15T19:52:37.407Z -- CyberPower -- PowerPanel business
item.description: An attacker with certain MQTT permissions can create malicious messages to all CyberPower PowerPanel devices. This could result in an attacker injecting SQL syntax, writing arbitrary files to the system, and executing remote code.
